title: Ouidah - is on the future UNESCO site
text: Ouidah is very impressive. the history, the museum, the sites, the people, the restaurant, everything about Ouidah is magical.

title: Well worth a visit
text:
It is well worth walking the whole of the Route des esclaves. You can start from the Ouidah Museum of History and end at the gate of no return. The museum itself has some fascinating images showing the assimilation that took place from west African slaves bringing food, dance, and culture over to the Americas. The artifacts and images from the slave trade are horrific and it really makes you think about the dreadful conditions these people were forced into. Well worth the time to tour around. 

Entrance is free although, at the end of the tour, you donate what you want to the guide. Guides can be conducted in both French and English.

title: Une partie triste de l'histoire de l'humanité
text: Même si triste, il faut connaître et se souvenir de cet partie de l'histoire afin que jamais quelque chose de semblable ne se reproduise

title: Incontournable...
text: Si vous êtes blanc à faire avec l'humilité et le devoir de recueillement qui s'impose ici, le musée comme tout autre lieux de mémoire au Bénin aurait besoin d'une bonne réhabilitation, mais la visite reste incontournable et les différents guides restent très compétant.

title: A faire mais assez décevant
text:
Il faut payer un droit d'entrée pour accéder à la porte, un guide local donne quelques explications sommaires.
Sans grand intérêt historique car la porte est un monument récent qui a pour seul objectif la "commémoration" de l'esclavagisme organisé de concert par les rois d'abomey et les portugais.
Il faut se documenter avant la visite et discuter du sujet après.
Intéressant pour les plus jeunes car cela permet d'initier une discussion sur les relations sociales en Afrique et le rôle des européens sur ce continent.

title: Un devoir de mémoire.
text:
Une grande route qui amène à la plage ou étaient embarqués les esclaves.
C'est juste émouvant de savoir que des miliers de personnes sont partis à cet endroit sans des conditions effroyables.

title: Lieu très conseillé remplis d'histoire
text: Bonjour , c'est un endroit très historique a visiter absolument. Si vous voulez faire partir de notre groupe de touristes internationaux pour visiter cet endroit et pleins d'autres au Bénin a l'occasion de la fête annuelle du vodoun en Janvier 2020  , contactez moi: +447554783736 .

title: Sad history
text: Worth a visit for the important but sad slave history. Also very beautiful architecturally and poignant. There were local guides and definitely worth getting one.

title: Contactez au (+229)95 44 74 78 Pour vous faire vivre le meilleur des temps de la traite négrière à nos jours.
text: Immortaliser l’histoire,faire vivre comme en temps réel,Les Emotions les larmes 😭 et des souvenirs.

title: Very sad history
text: It's quite an emotional journey following the route of the slaves. It is unbelievable what kind of cruelity they experienced. And to think that this was being done to them by fellow human being is pathetic. May this never happened again ever.

title: Sombering history
text: We walked the slave route starting from chacha place and ended at the gate of no return. A very powerful walk thinking about what the slaves that went through here went through. Would definitely recommend this.

title: Gate of No Return
text: The gate of no return was an amazing historic places one must not miss should they visit Benin. Along the way statues that has different meaning could be seen and with a good guide one will get their meanings

title: English speaking guide not around
text: It used to be the old Portuguese fort that is now a museum but unfortunately the English speaking guide was not around when we went. We were told he had gone to Cotonou and we could either wait for like 5 hours or return. We left!

title: Voodoo Festival.
text: This year Benin Voodoo festival was the best ever. Our guest enjoyed lot of fun and learn more about African cultures, traditions and believes.

title: Interesting history, great photos and pictures
text: It is the best establishment with regard to the history of slavery we have seen so far in the country  The Goulbenkian Foundation has done a great job in sending the collection and even though it is not well maintained, you find yourself looking eagerly at each and every exhibit. So interesting, so sad - not the least because of what the Africans did to their own people and how they exploited them so viciously

title: museo interessante
text: Museo da vedere, ben strutturato e ampio; indispensabile una guida che si reperisce all'ingresso. Alcune immagini sono le stesse che ho visto in un analogo museo di Salvador de Bahia dedicato al dramma dello schiavismo

title: Ouidahin museo
text:
Museossa käynti kannattaa ajoittaa ennen port of no returnille käyntiä. Museolta myös osaavat ohjata opastetulle ”kärsimysreitille”, joka päättyy rannan portille. 

Englanninkielinen opas seuraa museon kierroksella. Ei mitenkään säväyttävä museokokemus mutta jos olet läpikulkumatkalla on viitoitus ”valtatieltä” kunnossa. 

Valokuvaus tuttuun tapaan kielletty ja kohde ei ole lapsiystävällinen. 

Pihalla muutama matkamuistomyymälä. 

30min käynti opastuksineen.

title: Interesting slave history
text: The museum was quite small, there was an interesting history of the slave trade and some photos and other artefacts and it took about half hour to an hour to visit with guided tour mandatory. No photos allowed. It could be developed more to improve the museum. After the museum we went to the gate if no return which is very nice memorial monument.

title: the painful story of slaves
text: this places has a lot of history .a horrible period of mankind just because of skin colour. it was sad that a fellow human can treat other humans that way. we were escorted to slave markets, the final road before they were taken to slaves ship. we were told how the slaves were being treated before they took the slave ship to their master

title: rich history
text: The museum showcased the rich history and culture of the people of Benin and Ouidah. it also showed how most West African cultures are intricately linked.

title: Very interesting museum
text: Old, not welltained,but very interesting museum. Each one should know about this horrible episode of mankind.

title: Beaucoup d'émotion et une page noire de l'histoire de l'humanité
text: C'est certainement le lieu le plus marquant du Bénin. Ici une grande part sombre de l'histoire de l'humanité s'est déroulé avec le début du circuits infernal de la traite des noirs en Afrique. Le musé est riche en représentation et les explications faite par le guide sont très claires. Aucuns point n'est oublié et la responsabilité de tous les acteurs est mis en évidence. La visite s'est faite avec un ado et un jeune enfant. C'est très important de connaitre cette partie de l'histoire. Autre point très intéressant, c'est la mise en évidence des similitudes culturelles et traditionnelles entre le Brésil et les pays d'Afrique de l'Ouest.

title: Know your history
text:
A lot of history!!! You must hear and see for yourself. The history of the trans Atlantic slave trade and African kingdoms that existed during the time is truly a revealing one.

It's amazing how black communities in the diaspora (in places such as South America and the Caribbean) have preserved certain elements of their culture for centuries and the striking similarities between those cultures and that of certain West African communities today. 

P.S. This museum needs a face lift however... without damaging the history; I felt that it wasn't in the best of shape.

title: Excursion Trip
text:
With about 45 persons that day we drove down to Ouidah from Cotonou, almost an hour.

The road is smooth and free.  Two years before now, we couldn't ply the slave route because it was flooded.  We had to turn back.

If you are going to the point of no return in Ouidah, get a tour guide who should be able to let you know if the route is in perfect state.

What makes this tour site a 'must go' is the story being told about the slave trade way back centuries from the route to the point of no return arc.

title: Emouvant
text: Visite ce site si vraiment tu  aimerais mieux connaitre l'histoire de l'esclavage. C'était purement extraordinaire.

title: History cherished
text:
The museum is rich with antiques and it is encouraging to appreciate the managers for the preservations well done.

However, English speaking guides should be on a stand by for English speaking tourists.

It is a great place for those who value history.

title: Ouidah Museum
text: The museum have a lot of blood chilling history of slavey with lot of historical items  of how slavery was ran way back history.

title: Emotional Journey but Must Have a Guide
text:
My view may be a bit cloudy because it was an emotional place for me. This was a former slave Portuguese Fort that has been turned into a museum and you walk around rooms where pictures describe the unspeakable horrors slaves endured. We were on tour and the guide had arranged an English speaking guide for us who's a decent from a Brazilian slave who repatriated to Benin after slavery ended in Brazil. Of course, he admitted that his great grandfather at the time did not have knowledge of which country his ancestors had come from originally in Africa but he was following the wave of Brazilians who decided to call Ouidah home. 

I can't imagine visiting the museum without a guide because many of the pictures do not come with stories and that means you will miss out on so much. Plus the guide can help take you to the gate of no return which I think is part of the museum and also to other memorials which are there to honor slaves and the lives lost. It's a must do trip but just make sure to bring a guide!

title: No Museum, research the area and history before arriving
text: The Benin Government trying to help their citizens and visitors understand the history of the area and what has occurred here.  This is a monument not museum to the history of what took place here.  Research the trail and spend time to reflect this location and area before coming to the area.

title: The Museum of History of Ouidah has nothing to do with the Gate of No return Monument on the beach
text: The Gate of No return Monument on the beach,  of which there are a number of photographs here, is not The Museum of History of Ouidah. See the actual photo of the building which was originally Fort of São João Baptista de Ajudá built by the Portugese. There is not a lot inside just a few rooms with some artefacts and some explanations in French. Most could be self explanatory without a guide but our guide was quite informative and did add to the experience.

title: Not Great Museum BUT
text: It achieves its effect of making one reflect on Man's inhumanity to Man. The Fort where the .museum is housed was the nub for the slave trade. The Benin authorities should seek international funding to make this Museum worthy of what it is about and to improve the exhibits and their housing. Worth a visit as part of an overall insight into the pernicious and evil slave trade

title: An idiots guide to the Atlantic slave trade.
text: The museum is housed in the old Portugeuse fort that doubled as a slave holding centre on the Benin coast of west Africa. It gives a "no holds barred" account of the way in which the slaves were taken, held, mistreated and eventually made to exit the fort to walk, in chains, down a mile long route to the coast where they would then board the slave ships for the middle passage across the Atlantic to the Americas. Being located in the original fort at Ouidah leaves the traveler with the sense of impending doom and helplessness that the stolen lives must have felt at the time.

title: Eye Opening
text: A eye opening walk through the atrocities that were inflected to the African race for greed. We had an amazing guide Fostine who gave us a thorough historical narrative on the impact of the slave trade and the significance of the monuments and historical pieces. It is a place to visit and I was very happy that a lot of the historical monuments and artifacts were kept in good shape because in a lot of these historical sites things are not archived correctly. It is a beautiful village and you will get your fill with souvenir traders at the actual entrance to the beach Door Of No Return.

title: History of Benin
text:
Interesting history of Benin, a lot about slave trade.
Interesting museum and then follow the slave route to the monument. 
Ouidah is worth visiting for everyone who wants to get to know beninoise culture and history. Make sure you hire a local guide!

title: sensational
text: This is a sensationnel place, this is a part of history because slaves were deported thru this door.

title: Beautiful setting
text: This is the place where the people left when sold into slavery. It is hard to describe the feelings I had as I stood there at the beautiful monument honoring those who were forced to leave their homeland. It is one of those places that changes your perspective forever.

title: Impresionante recorrido
text: Lugar delque partian los esclavos, y tiene muchas cosas relacionadas con el tema que son muy interesantes, y merece la pena verlo, la fortaleza Portuguesa, LA PUERTA DEL NO RETORNO, CON SUS CUATRO KILOMETROS  DERECORRIDO.

title: Excellent et remémorant
text: Très bonne expérience avec la rencontre d'une population accueillante, souriante. On a la possibilité de revenir avec de bons souvenirs comme des tableaux peints, des perles, des statuettes fabriquées en bois

title: un monument aux esclaves
text: C'est un endroit de mémoire qui est mal entretenu et qui est un piège à touristes. Les écritures s'effacent et deviennent illisibles.

title: Important Piece of History
text: Symbolic of a dark time in human history, the exhibits are basic and only a few are from the era.  If you are in Ouidah it is a must see.

title: Simple but a must-do! Emblematic!
text: This is a very basic museum but emblematic enough to be visited. Enjoy some free time and a walk in the surroundings.

title: Visite à faire sur le site
text: On ne peut pas passer dans la région sans visiter ce site qui nous rappelle un bien triste passé. Très beau monument du souvenir.

title: Merece la pena
text: Ubicado en el antiguo fuerte portugués, el museo está algo destartalado y vacío de turistas. Es muy útil para conocer mejor la historia de la ciudad (reyes de Ouidah y mapas interesantes). El fuerte además es bonito de ver

title: Best if combined with the Route of the Slaves
text:
The museum itself is quite sparse, although a good guide can help to bring it altogether to give a good overview. Don't worry there are English speaking guides available and there is no obligation to tip (even if mentioned!).

It's best to combine this with the route of the slaves which can be organised through the museum or someone will find you! Again there are English speaking guides and you will need transport for this 4km route - a zem (motorbike) or your own car.

title: Une visite intéressante et émouvante
text: Une visite incontournable, en visitant le Bénin. Bien entretenu, bien présenté. Le Fort Portugais était l'un des lieux de rassemblement et de vente des esclaves. Bon accueil, la guide était bien informée, très intéressante. A ne pas manquer.

title: Good guided tour
text: We were impressed by the tour guide.  The museum has just enough in it to make it interesting. The guides explanation in English was well done

title: Musée non entretenu
text: Nous avions visité le musée en 2009. 7 ans après il est complètement détérioré. Les objets ont quasiment tous disparus il ne reste que des photos. Malgré cela nous avons eu un très bon guide qui a su rendre la visite très intéressante et prenante.

title: Impressionant
text:
Assez peu d objets sont presentes, mais le batiment lui meme est un ancien fort portugais, et cela suffit pour que le guide nous raconte 400 ans d histoire de son pays.
A ne pas rater

title: Knowledgeable staff who spoke English
text: My colleague took me here to learn about the slave trade & to see the Door of no Return. We started at the museum and were able to get an English speaking guide who took me through the museum - it's a little run down and the artefacts are displayed a bit shabbily but they still are able to tell the story of the Portuguese fort well. We were then able to get a different guide to ride in our car as we drove down the slave road to explain the different stops along the way. It was very informative and really helpful to have the guide as there are limited descriptive plaques. We finished at the Python temple where I could hold 2 snakes and have my picture taken.

title: Très touchant
text: Il est parfois impirtant de connaître et surtout de comprendre l'histoire d'un pays et de tout un peuple.. visite très enrichissante et très touchante. Si vous passez à Ouidah un stop est nécessaire !

title: very intersting location
text: i think visit to ouidah is must if you came to visit in Benin, the slave route and the musem are intersting locations which you can get short history lesson about the slavery time.

title: Sehr interessant
text: Auch wenn nicht sehr viele Exponate geboten werden, ist die Ausstellung gerade mit den Dokumenten der grausamen Sklavereigeschichte absolut sehenswert.

title: Sans intérêt... gardez votre guide du routard !
text: Dans un cadre plus proche de la décharge que d'un musée visant à retracer l'histoire d'un peuple et d'une ville capitale dans l'histoire de la traite négrière, vous ne pouvez vous déplacer dans la présence d'un guide (qui n'a de guide que le nom) qui visiblement s'entraine pour un sprint... visite bâclée, explications toujours attendues et surtout surtout... vestiges essentiellement constitués de photocopies... bref, amateurs d'histoire... passez votre chemin;

title: Denkmal und Hütten
text: Ein Museum gibt es hier nicht. Man kann das Gate of no return besichtigen. Auf dem großen Platz finden am 10.01. die Vodoo Festlichkeiten statt. Es liegt außerhalb von Ouidah (15 Min Fahrt). Eine Ansammlung von Souvenirshops und zwei Bars. Die Straße runter gibt es noch ein Denkmal vom Papst J.Paul II und das Gate of Return zu besichtigen. Auf der Strecke liegen einige Restaurants.

title: Mediocre
text: Il monumento non è poi sto granché, è importante vederlo più che altro per rendersi conto delle atrocità di cui l'uomo è capace.

title: A Portuguese Fort rebuilt in 1968: mostly empty rooms
text:
The arch way in the photo is the "Point of Return" on the shore of the sea. Slaves were marched the 4km from Ouidah on the Rue des Esclaves. It is the point of return because the slaves believed there spirits would return even if their bodies did not.
The museum is housed in what was the Portuguese fort which was burned down after independence. Little of the original remains, what you see is mostly a reconstruction. There are few items of real interest inside, some are reproductions.

title: Très émouvant !
text: Sur la route des esclaves, trop d'émotions à penser que des millions d'êtres humains, vendus par leurs rois, sont partis de ces côtes pour servir d'esclave

title: Small but nice museum in an historic building
text: This rather interesting museum is located in the old Forte de São João Baptista de Ajudá. This fort has an interesting history. With its 5 acres (~2 ha), it was at one time the world’s smallest internationally-recognized political unit. It was built on land given to Portugal by King Haffon of Ouidah in 1721, and remained under Portuguese administrative control until Jul 31, 1961. On Aug 1 of the previous year, Dahomey (now Benin) had become independent, and its new government gave Portugal one year to vacate the premises and move on! When the ultimatum expired, the resident Portuguese population of the fort (2 inhabitants, down from 5 in 1921…) tried to set it on fire, rather than surrender it to the new country. The issue only reached closure in 1975, i.e., after the Portuguese revolution of the previous year, when Portugal recognized Dahomey’s sovereignty over the fort. In 1987, the Fundação Gulbenkian of Portugal funded the full rehabilitation of the historic facility, which now houses Ouidah’s Museum of History.

title: History
text: Hmmmmm. This is a must visit if you are in Cotonou. We arrived here and got a volunteer guide to take us around after we paid the official government tariff. Harry our guide was very good and told the stories with a lot of empathy.

title: site UNESCO sur esclavage
text: très bon site historique à ne pas râter à Ouidah pour connaître les méandres de l'esclavage dans le Golfe de Guinée

title: Le parcours des esclaves: un devoir de mémoire
text:
La fondation Zinsou, abrîte le premier musée d’art contemporain africain. Le musée Zinsou de Ouidah est d’abord la rénovation d’une œuvre architecturale unique.

Ouidah qui se veut « villes de tous les patrimoines » avec son histoire dense honore les artistes contemporains africains. Cyprien Tokoudagba, Samuel Fosso, Romuald Hazoumé, SolyCissé, le musée d’arts africains de Ouidah vous donne rendez-vous pour une autre facette de l’Afrique. Une facette qui jusque-là ne pouvait être visitée qu’à Paris, New-York, et autres grandes villes occidentales.

Très belle initiative ce musée dont j'ai beaucoup apprécié la visite.

title: endroit au milieu de nul part
text: la porte du non retour fut errigé par rapport à l'esclavagisme de l'epoque. Les portuguais faisait monter en particulier les.youroubas dans des bateaux à cet endroit la. certains se jetaient à l'eau pour ne pas quitter leur terre. le chemin commence à ouida.

title: Nice place
text:
The Ouidah Museum of History contains a small, but very interesting. exhibition of objects related with the history of slavery and the religious and cultural relations between Benin and Brazil, thanks to the trafiic of slaves, brought from Benin in the XVII, XVIII and XIX centuries. 
The local tour guides are very good, well educated and available to answer all questions. 
The Musuem islocated inside na old portuguese fort of the early XVIII century, what is a plus.

title: Histoire du pays
text: Passage obligé pour connaitre un peu l'histoire de l'esclavage par les Portugais et les Français au Bénin. Endroit imprégné d'un passé douloureux qu'on peut encore ressentir.

title: poor but full of history
text: I was reluctant to hire a guide but, that is the best choice. I high recommend NOT to hire the opportunist people that always will surround to you there but hire one at Municipality Turist Office, particularly to Mr. CARLOMAGNO, the most well english speaker guy there. He is the guy who build some of the monuments along the way to reach the slaves-gate (on the pic). (he's kindly, selfless, and he will take care well of your necesities, avoiding thieves). On the  gate there are not too much to see, the beach is nice even looks abandoned. This slaves-rute and a free musem (zinsao... -I'm not sure about the name) is the best (and unique) realy nice thing to know in all the country. Price approx. 20 USD.

title: =D
text:
O Museu conta a história de reis antigos, a passagem dos portugueses e outros povos pelo Benin.

Em muitos aspectos consegui ver familiaridades entre as culturas do Brasil e do Bénin. Vale a pena!

title: Intereesting if sad.
text: Got take on a tour by an amusing local and he jovially explained there was no money in the  treasure box.  Get a book called the Viceroy of Ouidah to find out more about the place and the Da Silvas. Yayi Bonis wife is a DaSilva.

title: Musée décevant
text: Le musée pourrait être bien, si on pouvait le visiter librement, sans la houlette obligatoire d'un guide. On aimerait flâner, lire les légendes, imaginer ou retrouver ce qu'on aura lu, ou ce qu'on lira ensuite.

title: Exposição interessante
text: Gostamos muito desse museu, apesar dele ter o mesmo inconveniente que muitos dos outros que visitamos na Africa: quase nenhuma explicação escrita, por isso a qualidade da visita depende do guia. Dois pontos altos: exposição sobre o paralelo entre a cultura brasileira e a africana; uma exposição sobre as mascaras usadas para certas danças por uma sociedade secreta.

title: Museo molto carino
text: È la storia e le verità di questo Paese. Se siete in Benin e passate di la, andate a vederlo. Vi sono rappresentazioni e quadri molto carini e pieni si significato e valore umano.

title: Interesting photography
text: The museum is very interesting, our guide was too. There is also an exhibition about the parallel between the voodoo culture in Benin and Brazil, with beautiful photographs.

title: Douloureuse route des esclaves
text: Le Musée est un fort portugais qui retrace l'histoire de l'esclavage. Et la présence coloniale des portugais et des français. Possibilité moyennant finance de faire la route des esclaves avec le guide jusqu'à la porte de non retour.

title: Het verleden zichtbaar
text:
Ongeveer 30 minuten met de auto vanaf Cotonou ligt het stadje Quidah, het stadje is nauwelijks bekend in de buitenwereld maar toch bevinden zich hier enkele bijzondere locaties en gebeurtenissen vanuit het verleden.
Volgens de overleving bevindt de oorsprong van VOODOO zich in deze omgeving en is er een VOODOO Museum vlak buiten het stadje, waar men je meer kan vertellen over de rituelen en gebruiken van VOODOO. Advies: neem een vertrouwde chauffeur mee bv vanuit je hotel en fotografeer mensen pas na dat je toestemming hebt gekregen.
In de stad Quidah bevind zich het Portugese Fort waar in het verleden de slaven werden verzameld en door de Portugezen naar o.a. Brazilië werden verscheept, het Fort is nog geheel intact en is nu als museum en dagelijks te bezoeken.   
Na het bezoek aan het museum kan je via de marktplaats naar de kust rijden, ca. 5 km., over dit pad moesten de slaven lopen naar de schepen die voor de kust lagen. Op dit pad staan nog de beelden waarlangs ze moesten lopen om afscheid te nemen van hun land. Ook bevindt zich halverwege dit pad een dorpje waar VOODOO priesters hun rituelen uitvoeren. Fotografeer niet zonder toestemming!
Aangekomen bij de kust staat er nu een monument op de plaats waar de slaven Afrika hebben verlaten, al met al een zeer indrukwekkende locatie.
Langs de kust kan je dan weer terug naar Cotonou.

title: Intéressant mais attention aux propositions des pseudo guides
text: L'endroit est intéressant à visiter mais ne donner aucune suite aux propositions que font certains des guides du musée pour vous accompagner à la fête vaudou par exemple ou pour vous expliquer la route des esclaves... ils ne cherchent qu'à vous arnaquer et à vous soutirez de l'argent.

title: Some interest, but not much presentation
text: There were some interesting pieces on display here, showing the history of the city and the fort, but everything felt run-down and ignored.  Most of the information concerned the Portuguese control of the city and their missionaries; I got very little information on the indigenous people or how they lived.  I just feel like so much more could be done with this place.

title: O.K. aber besser gleich zum Office de Tourisme
text: Das kleine Museum ist durchaus sehenswert. Viel sinnvoller aber ist, sich zum Office de Tourisme zu begeben, um dort gestaffelt nach Länge sich von einem ortskundigen Führer das zeigen zu lassen, was in der Geschichte dieses Jahrhunderte alten Städchen an Orten, Strassenbzügen, Märkten lles noch zu sehen ist. Diese Führung ist wirklich erstklassig unde rspärt langes überflüssiges Lesen in halbgaren Reuseführern.

title: Interessant und gut gemacht
text: Das Museum ist sehr authentisch und übersichtlich. Die Tour dauert ca. 20min. Sehenswert ist die Fotoausstellung.

title: On est mal à l'aise, mais cela fait partie de l'histoire...
text:
On ne peut pas se rendre au Bénin, sans faire une halte à Ouidah et visiter cet ancien fort portugais si chargé de souvenirs terribles...
On s'imprègne de l'histoire de presque un million d'esclaves, de leurs conditions de détention avant leur grand départ pour l'Atlantique ( pour ceux qui arrivaient à survivre...) 
L'ambiance est chargée, pesante, On imagine les souffrances endurées, on en voit les traces, on comprend la bêtise humaine.
Commencez par visiter le fort avec ses casernes, sa chapelle, ses objets conservés dans la résidence.
Puis suivez le chemin de 4 km jusqu'à la plage d'où partaient les bateaux, en passant par la place aux enchères, l'arbre de l'oubli et la porte du non retour.
Imprégnez vous de cette ambiance terrible et, une fois parvenu sur la plage, soufflez un peu. Vous en aurez besoin.
L'endroit est vraiment magnifique.
